Primary_Text: urgo sagər măjagən kubi: maʔ nuga
Analyzed: urgo sagər măja-gən ku-bi: maʔ nu-ga
Gloss: big black mountain-LOC see-PST tent stand-PRS
Translation: On the big black mountain s/he saw: a tent is standing
S/he came while I was eating
S/he took out a woman’s dead body
Give me some porridge to eat!

Primary_Text: dĭ nüke kambi, kambi, iššo maʔ kubi
Analyzed: dĭ nüke kam-bi, kam-bi, iššo maʔ ku-bi
Gloss: DEM wife go-PST go-PST else tent see-PST
Translation: The woman went, went, found another tent

Primary_Text: i döbǝr amnoźittǝ šobiiʔ, kamǝn šĭšǝge molāmbi
Analyzed: i döbǝr amno-źit-tǝ šo-bi-iʔ, kamǝn šĭšǝge mo=lām-bi
Gloss: and hereto live-INF-LAT come-PST-3PL when cold become=RES-PST
Translation: And they came here to live when it had become cold
As it sees (lit. in its seeing), there is a tent standing
They were hunted with a gun
I got up early and lit the fire
There is no woman around here

Primary_Text: ej surarga kānǝm kānǝn noʔbdǝ tonnaʔbǝ
Analyzed: ej surar-ga kān-ǝm kān-ǝn noʔb-dǝ tonnaʔbǝ
Gloss: NEG ask-PTCP khan-ACC khan-GEN grass-POSS.3SG step.on.DUR.PRS
Translation: without asking the Khan he steps on the Khan’s grass
a horse that has been eaten

Primary_Text: kömǝ poʔdǝ iʔböne ťogǝn noʔ ej özerie
Analyzed: kömǝ poʔdǝ iʔb=ö-ne ťo-gǝn noʔ ej özer-ie.
Gloss: red goat lie=DUR-PTCP place-LOC grass not grow-PRS
Translation: At a place where the red goat had been lying grass doesn’t grow

Primary_Text: ej surarga kānǝm kānǝn noʔbdǝ tonnaʔbǝ
Analyzed: ej surar-ga kān-ǝm kān-ǝn noʔb-dǝ tonnaʔbǝ
Gloss: not ask-PTCP khan-ACC khan-GEN grass-POSS.3SG step.on.DUR.PRS
Translation: Without asking the Khan he steps on the Khan’s grass
Put the eating board on the floor!
S/he came while I was eating
(In case of your) eating this man you will cry

Primary_Text: dĭ ne aspaʔdǝbǝ ibi, šü-ndǝ toʔgǝndǝ nuldǝbi
Analyzed: dĭ ne aspaʔ-dǝ-bǝ i-bi, šü-ndǝ toʔ-gǝndǝ nu=ldǝ-bi
Gloss: DEM woman cauldron-3SG-ACC.3SG take-PST fire-GEN.3SG side-LAT/LOC.3SG stand=TR-PST
Translation: The woman took her cauldron, and placed it at the side of her fire
at the side, to the side : at the side : from the side
to his/her tent, in his/her tent
The head (lit. her/his head) made a roll
S/he is the worst person of all
There lived a man with his wife
S/he took wood and was going (home)
And s/he herself/himself went picking berries
